TestCase.Name: WopiValidatorPrereq
TestCase.Description: The prereq WOPI validation that must pass prior to running the (potentially destructive) test suite.

TestCase.Name: UserCanWritePrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the user has permission to perform Write operation.

TestCase.Name: UserCanNotWriteRelativePrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the user is denied permission to call PutRelativeFile.

TestCase.Name: UserCanWriteRelativePrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the user has permission to call PutRelativeFile.

TestCase.Name: ContainersPrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the host declares support for Containers operations.

TestCase.Name: ContainersUnsupportedPrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check that the host does NOT support Containers operations. This can be used in cases where a test group should be skipped if the host DOES support Containers operations.

TestCase.Name: EcosystemPrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the host declares support for Ecosystem operations.

TestCase.Name: LocksPrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the host declares support for Lock/Unlock/RefreshLock/UnlockAndRefreshLock operations.

TestCase.Name: FileEditingPrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if host declares support for PutFile/PutRelativeFile operations.

TestCase.Name: GetLockPrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if host declares support for GetLock operation.

TestCase.Name: ExtendedLockLengthPrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if host declares support for extended lock lengths.

TestCase.Name: BusinessFlowPrereq
TestCase.Description: The prereq BusinessFlowPrereq must pass prior to running the feature validations related to business flows.

TestCase.Name: DeleteFilePrereq
TestCase.Description: The host must support /files/DeleteFile.

TestCase.Name: FileUrlUsagePrereq
TestCase.Description: The host uses FileUrl for direct file access.

TestCase.Name: SupportedShareUrlTypesForFilePrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the host sets SupportedShareUrlTypes in CheckFileInfo to any value.

TestCase.Name: ShareUrlTypeReadOnlyForFilePrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the host declares support for the "ReadOnly" Share Url type for the file.

TestCase.Name: ShareUrlTypeReadWriteForFilePrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the host declares support for the "ReadWrite" Share Url type for the file.

TestCase.Name: SupportedShareUrlTypesForContainerPrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the host sets SupportedShareUrlTypes in CheckContainerInfo to any value.

TestCase.Name: ShareUrlTypeReadOnlyForContainerPrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the host declares support for the "ReadOnly" Share Url type for the container.

TestCase.Name: ShareUrlTypeReadWriteForContainerPrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the host declares support for the "ReadWrite" Share Url type for the container.

TestCase.Name: RenameFilePrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if host declares support for RenameFile operation.

TestCase.Name: UserCanCreateChildFilePrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the user has permission to call CreateChildFile operation.

TestCase.Name: AddActivitiesPrereq
TestCase.Description: The host must support /files/AddActivities.

TestCase.Name: UserCanRenameContainerPrereq
TestCase.Description: Prereq WOPI Validation test to check if the user has permissions to call RenameContainer.

TestCase.Name: SupportsUserInfoPrereq
TestCase.Description: The host must support /files/PutUserInfo.

TestCase.Name: SupportsCoauthPrereq
TestCase.Description: The host must support coauth.

TestCase.Name: SupportsChunkedFileTransferPrereq
TestCase.Description: The host must support Incremental File Transfer protocol.

TestCase.Name: FullCheckFileInfoSchema
TestCase.Description: This tests that hosts' CheckFileInfo responses conform to the JSON schema.

TestCase.Name: HostUrls
TestCase.Description: This tests that the Host* URLs provided by the host are not Office Online action URLs.

TestCase.Name: CheckFileWithInvalidAccessToken
TestCase.Description: Simulates a CheckFileInfo request with invalid access token and expects a 401 or 404 response.

TestCase.Name: ViewOnlySupport
TestCase.Description: Standard sequence of requests made by a WOPI client to render a document.

TestCase.Name: GetUnlockedFile
TestCase.Description: GetFile requests on a file that wasn't locked before - necessary for Viewing and Editing.

TestCase.Name: LockLengthValidation
TestCase.Description: Tests that the WOPI host is capable of handling WOPI Lock IDs of 256 characters.

TestCase.Name: LockFormatValidation
TestCase.Description: Tests that Office locks, which happen to be JSON-formatted strings today, are handled properly by the host.

TestCase.Name: SuccessfulLockSequence
TestCase.Description: Simulates a successful sequence of lock-related requests: Lock, RefreshLock, UnlockAndRelock, Unlock.

TestCase.Name: LockMismatchAfterUnlockAndRelockRequest
TestCase.Description: Simulates a successful UnlockAndRelock followed by Unlock with old lock. This tests that UnlockAndRelock actually changes the lock string

TestCase.Name: DoubleLockSequence
TestCase.Description: Two Lock calls in a row with the same Lock ID should work.

TestCase.Name: UnlockUnlockedFile
TestCase.Description: Responses to Unlock requests on an unlocked file should include the X-WOPI-Lock header set to the empty string.

TestCase.Name: LockMismatchOnLockRequest
TestCase.Description: Simulates a lock mismatch when trying to refresh the lock. Validates that the current lock ID is returned as response header.

TestCase.Name: LockMismatchOnUnlockRequest
TestCase.Description: Simulates a lock mismatch when trying to unlock the file. Validates that the current lock ID is returned as response header.

TestCase.Name: LockMismatchOnRefreshLockRequest
TestCase.Description: Simulates a lock mismatch when trying to refresh the lock. Validates that the current lock ID is returned as response header.

TestCase.Name: LockMismatchOnUnlockAndRelockRequest
TestCase.Description: Simulates a lock mismatch when trying to unlock and relock the file. Validates that the current lock ID is returned as response header.

TestCase.Name: LockMismatchOnPutFileRequest
TestCase.Description: Simulates a lock mismatch when trying to refresh the lock. Validates that the current lock ID is returned as response header.

TestCase.Name: LockFileWithInvalidAccessToken
TestCase.Description: Tests Lock operation with an invalid access token and expects a 401 or 404 response.

TestCase.Name: UnlockFileWithInvalidAccessToken
TestCase.Description: Tests Unlock operation with an invalid access token and expects a 401 or 404 response.

TestCase.Name: files.GetLock
TestCase.Description: Tests the standard GetLock flow; Lock, GetLock, then Unlock.

TestCase.Name: files.GetLockAfterChange
TestCase.Description: Tests that the lock ID GetLock returns changes after it's changed by UnlockAndRelock.

TestCase.Name: files.GetLockOnUnlockedFile
TestCase.Description: Tests GetLock after a file has been locked and unlocked.

TestCase.Name: files.ExtendedLockLengthValidation
TestCase.Description: Tests that the WOPI host is capable of handling WOPI Lock IDs of 1024 characters.

TestCase.Name: BasicEdit
TestCase.Description: Standard sequence of requests made by an edit-capable WOPI client as part of application boot and successful saves when user interacts with the document.

TestCase.Name: EditNoChange
TestCase.Description: Simulates an editor boot and save with no changes to a file.

TestCase.Name: PutUnlockedFile
TestCase.Description: Simulates creating a new file on the host, which requires PutFile requests to an unlocked 0-byte file to succeed.

TestCase.Name: PutUnlockedFileNotZeroBytes
TestCase.Description: This tests that PutFile requests fail when executed against files that are not zero bytes.

TestCase.Name: GetPutFileWithInvalidAccessToken
TestCase.Description: Simulates Get and PutFile requests with invalid access token and expects a 401 or 404 response.

TestCase.Name: files.GetFileReturnsVersion
TestCase.Description: /files/GetFile should return the current version of the file

TestCase.Name: files.LockReturnsVersion
TestCase.Description: /files/Lock should return the current version of the file

TestCase.Name: files.UnlockReturnsVersion
TestCase.Description: /files/Unlock should return the current version of the file

TestCase.Name: files.PutFileReturnsVersion
TestCase.Description: /files/PutFile should return the current version of the file

TestCase.Name: files.PutFileReturnsDifferentVersion
TestCase.Description: Performs consecutive PutFile operations to verify that the X-WOPI-ItemVersion header value is changed with every PutFile operation.

TestCase.Name: files.LockAndUnlockAfterGetFileReturnsSameVersion
TestCase.Description: Performs Lock and Unlock operations after a GetFile operation to verify that the X-WOPI-ItemVersion header value is unchanged.

TestCase.Name: PutUserInfoSucceeds
TestCase.Description: PutUserInfo call returns 200 and subsequent CheckFileInfo calls return the correct value

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.SuggestedExtension
TestCase.Description: Tests the basic PutRelativeFile scenario where a suggested extension is specified.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.SuggestedName
TestCase.Description: Tests the basic PutRelativeFile scenario where a suggested name is specified.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.SuggestedNameConflict
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where a suggested name is specified but a file with the target name already exists. Expects the request to succeed with the host choosing a suitable name.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.RelativeName
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where a Relative name is specified. Expects the created file to have the exact name specified.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.RelativeNameOverwriteTrueNoEffect
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is set to true. Since no file with target name exists in this scenario, the header should have no effect.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.RelativeNameOverwriteFalseNoEffect
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is set to false. Since no file with target name exists in this scenario, the header should have no effect.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.RelativeNameConflictNoOverwrite
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is not specified. Since a file with target name exists in this scenario, this should return a 409.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.RelativeNameConflictOverwriteFalse
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is set to false. Since a file with target name exists in this scenario, this should return a 409.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.RelativeNameConflictOverwriteTrue
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is set to true.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.ConflictingHeaders
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where both a suggested name and a relative name are specified.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.RelativeNameConflictOverwriteTrueLocked
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where a relative name is specified along with OverwriteRelative set to true, but a file with the same target name already exists and is locked.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.FileNameReturnedIsCorrectlyEncoded
TestCase.Description: Tests that the host returns a UTF-8 encoded version of the FileName after a PutRelativeFile operation.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFile.FileNameLongerThan512Chars
TestCase.Description: Tests that the host handles long file names appropriately by either supporting them or returning a 400.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFileUnsupported.SuggestedExtension
TestCase.Description: Tests the basic PutRelativeFile scenario where a suggested extension is specified.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFileUnsupported.SuggestedName
TestCase.Description: Tests the basic PutRelativeFile scenario where a suggested name is specified.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFileUnsupported.RelativeName
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where a Relative name is specified.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFileUnsupported.RelativeNameOverwriteTrueNoEffect
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is set to true.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFileUnsupported.RelativeNameOverwriteFalseNoEffect
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is set to false.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeFileUnsupported.ConflictingHeaders
TestCase.Description: Tests the PutRelativeFile scenario where both a suggested name and a relative name are specified.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeAndRenameFile.RenameShouldSucceed
TestCase.Description: Perform a PutRelativeFile operation, then rename and delete it. The rename operation should succeed.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeAndRenameFile.FileNameAfterRenameIsCorrectlyEncoded
TestCase.Description: Perform a PutRelativeFile operation, then rename it with a file name containing a special character and delete it. The rename operation should succeed and the server should return the name as a UTF-8 encoded string.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeAndRenameFile.RenamingALockedFileWithACorrectLockHeaderValueShouldSucceed
TestCase.Description: Perform a PutRelativeFile operation, then lock it and try to rename it with the correct lock ID. The rename operation should succeed.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeAndRenameFile.RenamingALockedFileWithAnIncorrectLockHeaderValueShouldReturnA409
TestCase.Description: Perform a PutRelativeFile operation, then lock it and try to rename it with an incorrect lock ID. The rename operation should fail with a Conflict - 409 status code.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeAndRenameFile.RenamingADeletedFileShouldReturnA404
TestCase.Description: Perform a PutRelativeFile operation, then delete it and try to rename it. The rename operation should fail with a 404 status code.

TestCase.Name: PutRelativeAndRenameFile.RenameShouldNotChangeFileExtension
TestCase.Description: Perform a PutRelativeFile operation, then rename and delete it. The rename operation should not change the file extension of the file.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFileAndRenameFile.RenameShouldSucceed
TestCase.Description: Create a file, then rename and delete it. The rename operation should succeed.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFileAndRenameFile.FileNameAfterRenameIsCorrectlyEncoded
TestCase.Description: Create a file, then rename it with a file name containing a special character and delete it. The rename operation should succeed and the server should return the name as a UTF-8 encoded string.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFileAndRenameFile.RenamingALockedFileWithACorrectLockHeaderValueShouldSucceed
TestCase.Description: Create a file, then lock it and try to rename it with the correct lock ID. The rename operation should succeed.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFileAndRenameFile.RenamingALockedFileWithAnIncorrectLockHeaderValueShouldReturnA409
TestCase.Description: Create a file, then lock it and try to rename it with an incorrect lock ID. The rename operation should fail with a Conflict - 409 status code.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFileAndRenameFile.RenamingADeletedFileShouldReturnA404
TestCase.Description: Create a file, then delete it and try to rename it. The rename operation should fail with a 404 status code.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFileAndRenameFile.RenameShouldNotChangeFileExtension
TestCase.Description: Create a file, then rename and delete it. The rename operation should not change the file extension of the file.

TestCase.Name: files.GetEcosystem
TestCase.Description: Tests that GetEcosystem returns a valid response.

TestCase.Name: ecosystem.CheckEcosystem
TestCase.Description: Tests that CheckEcosystem returns a valid response.

TestCase.Name: ecosystem.GetRootContainer
TestCase.Description: Tests that GetRootContainer returns a valid response.

TestCase.Name: ecosystem.GetRootContainerInvalidAccessToken
TestCase.Description: Tests that GetRootContainer denies requests with invalid access tokens.

TestCase.Name: containers.CheckContainerInfo
TestCase.Description: Tests that CheckContainerInfo returns a valid response.

TestCase.Name: containers.CreateAndDeleteChildContainer
TestCase.Description: Tests creating a child container and deleting it.

TestCase.Name: containers.CreateAndDeleteChildContainerDupe
TestCase.Description: Tests that CreateChildContainer handles 'suggested mode' properly.

TestCase.Name: containers.CreateAndDeleteChildContainerExactName
TestCase.Description: Tests that CreateChildContainer handles 'specific mode' properly.

TestCase.Name: containers.CreateAndDeleteChildContainerExactNameDupe
TestCase.Description: Tests that CreateChildContainer handles conflicting container names when in 'specific mode' properly.

TestCase.Name: containers.GetEcosystem
TestCase.Description: /files/EnumerateAncestors then /containers/GetEcosystem on each element

TestCase.Name: containers.LicensingPropertiesOnChildFolderMatchWithParentFolder
TestCase.Description: Verify that some CheckContainerInfo user properties match between a child container and its parent.

TestCase.Name: containers.CreateAndRenameChildContainer
TestCase.Description: Tests that RenameContainer is handled properly.

TestCase.Name: containers.CreateAndRenameChildContainerAndVerifyReturnedContainerNameIsCorrectlyEncoded
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.RenameChildContainer scenario where a Relative name is specified. Expect the host to rename the container with the exact name as specified. Also ensure that the host returns a UTF-8 encoded version of the ContainerName.

TestCase.Name: files.EnumerateAncestors
TestCase.Description: just EnumerateAncestors

TestCase.Name: containers.EnumerateChildren
TestCase.Description: /files/EnumerateAncestors then /containers/EnumerateChildren on the parent folder

TestCase.Name: containers.EnumerateChildrenOnRoot
TestCase.Description: /files/EnumerateAncestors then /containers/EnumerateChildren on the root folder

TestCase.Name: containers.EnumerateChildrenWithOneFilter
TestCase.Description: /files/EnumerateAncestors then /containers/EnumerateChildren on the parent folder with a file extension filter

TestCase.Name: containers.EnumerateChildrenWithMultipleFilters
TestCase.Description: /files/EnumerateAncestors then /containers/EnumerateChildren on the parent folder with multiple file extensions filtered

TestCase.Name: containers.EnumerateAncestorsOnRoot
TestCase.Description: /files/EnumerateAncestors then /containers/EnumerateAncestors on a container which is a root container

TestCase.Name: containers.EnumerateAncestorsOnChildren
TestCase.Description: /files/EnumerateAncestors then /containers/EnumerateAncestors on a container which is not a root container

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFileAndDelete
TestCase.Description: /files/EnumerateAncestors then go to a container that has UserCanCreateChildFile=true. create a file. delete it.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.SuggestedName
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where a suggested name is specified.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.SuggestedNameConflict
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where a suggested name is specified but a file with the target name already exists. Expect the request to succeed with the host choosing a suitable name.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.RelativeName
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where a Relative name is specified. Expect the host to create a new file with the exact name as specified.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.RelativeNameOverwriteTrueNoEffect
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is set to true. Since no file with target name exists in this scenario, the header should have no effect. Expect the host to create a new file with the exact name as specified.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.RelativeNameOverwriteFalseNoEffect
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is set to false. Since no file with target name exists in this scenario, the header should have no effect. Expect the host to create a new file with the exact name as specified.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.RelativeNameConflictNoOverwrite
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is not specified. Since a file with target name exists in this scenario, expect the host to return 409 status code as conflict.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.RelativeNameConflictOverwriteFalse
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is set to false. Since a file with target name exists in this scenario, expect the host to return 409 status code as conflict.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.RelativeNameConflictOverwriteTrue
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where a Relative name is specified and OverwriteRelative is set to true. Since a file with target name exists in this scenario, expect the host to succeed by choosing a suitable name.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.ConflictingHeaders
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where both a suggested name and a relative name are specified. Expect the host to fail the request as bad request.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.RelativeNameConflictOverwriteTrueLocked
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where a relative name is specified along with OverwriteRelative set to true, but a file with the same target name already exists and is locked. Expect the host to fail the request with a 409 conflict code.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.FileNameReturnedIsCorrectlyEncoded
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where a Relative name is specified. Expect the host to create a new file with the exact name as specified. Also ensure that the host returns a UTF-8 encoded version of the FileName.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.FileNameLongerThan512Characters
TestCase.Description: Tests the Containers.CreateChildFile scenario where a file name is longer than 512 characters, then the host should return a 400 or 200.

TestCase.Name: CreateChildFile.LicensingPropertiesOnChildFileMatchWithParentFolder
TestCase.Description: Verify that some CheckContainerInfo and CheckFileInfo user properties match between a child file and its parent container.

TestCase.Name: GetFromFileUrlAfterPutFile
TestCase.Description: Tests that the FileUrl returns updated content after a PutFile request, since FileUrl is intended to be a drop in replacement for GetFile.

TestCase.Name: GetFromFileUrl
TestCase.Description: Use FileUrl, if provided, to directly retrieve the contents of a file instead of using GetFile.

TestCase.Name: files.GetShareUrlForReadOnlyUrlType
TestCase.Description: Tests the GetShareUrl operation for a file where the requested share url type is "ReadOnly".

TestCase.Name: files.GetShareUrlForReadWriteUrlType
TestCase.Description: Tests the GetShareUrl operation for a file where the requested share url type is "ReadWrite".

TestCase.Name: files.GetShareUrlForUnknownUrlType
TestCase.Description: Tests the GetShareUrl operation for a file where the requested share url type is unknown.

TestCase.Name: containers.GetShareUrlForReadOnlyUrlType
TestCase.Description: Tests the GetShareUrl operation for a container where the requested share url type is "ReadOnly".

TestCase.Name: containers.GetShareUrlForReadWriteUrlType
TestCase.Description: Tests the GetShareUrl operation for a container where the requested share url type is "ReadWrite".

TestCase.Name: containers.GetShareUrlForUnknownUrlType
TestCase.Description: Tests the GetShareUrl operation for a container where the requested share url type is unknown.

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesSingleMinimalComment
TestCase.Description: one comment, minimal properties

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesSingleFullComment
TestCase.Description: one comment with all data properties set

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesAllCapsID
TestCase.Description: one comment with all-caps ID GUID

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesMaxLengthContentID
TestCase.Description: one comment with max-length ContentID

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesMaxLengthNavigationId
TestCase.Description: one comment with max-length NavigationId

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesCommentUpdate
TestCase.Description: one comment with ContentAction=update

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesCommentDelete
TestCase.Description: one comment with ContentAction=delete

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesWithBonusToplevelProperty
TestCase.Description: one comment with bogus additional toplevel property

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesWithBonusDataProperty
TestCase.Description: one comment with bogus additional data property

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesCommentAndPerson
TestCase.Description: one comment, one person

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesCommentWithThreePeople
TestCase.Description: one comment, three people

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesCommentWithPersonBonusProperty
TestCase.Description: one comment, one person with bogus additional property

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesCommentWithNonWopiPerson
TestCase.Description: one comment, one person with non-wopi provider and ID

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesUnknownActivityType
TestCase.Description: one activity with bogus type

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesUnknownNoDataActivity
TestCase.Description: one activity with bogus type and no data

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesTwoActivitiesOneUnknown
TestCase.Description: one comment and one activity with bogus type

TestCase.Name: files.AddActivitiesThreeComments
TestCase.Description: three comments

TestCase.Name: ProofKeys.CurrentValid.OldValid
TestCase.Description: Tests that hosts accept requests where the X-WOPI-Proof value is correctly signed with the current proof key, and the X-WOPI-ProofOld value is signed with the old proof key.

TestCase.Name: ProofKeys.CurrentValid.OldInvalid
TestCase.Description: Tests that hosts accept requests where the X-WOPI-Proof value is correctly signed with the current proof key, but the X-WOPI-ProofOld value is invalid. This scenario is unusual and should not happen in a production environment, but since the X-WOPI-Proof value is signed with the current public key, the request should be accepted.

TestCase.Name: ProofKeys.CurrentInvalid.OldValidSignedWithCurrentKey
TestCase.Description: Tests that hosts accept requests where the X-WOPI-Proof value is invalid but the X-WOPI-ProofOld value is signed with current public key. This can happen when a WOPI client such as Office Online has rotated proof keys but the host hasn't re-run WOPI discovery yet.

TestCase.Name: ProofKeys.CurrentValidSignedWithOldKey.OldInvalid
TestCase.Description: Tests that hosts accept requests where the X-WOPI-ProofOld value is invalid but the X-WOPI-Proof value is signed with old public key. This can happen when a WOPI client has rotated proof keys, the host has re-run WOPI discovery and has the updated keys, but the datacenter machine making the WOPI request does not yet have the updated keys.

TestCase.Name: ProofKeys.CurrentInvalid.OldValidSignedWithOldKey
TestCase.Description: Tests that hosts reject requests where the X-WOPI-Proof value is invalid, and the X-WOPI-ProofOld value is signed with the old public key. This scenario is unusual and should not happen in a production environment; such requests should be rejected.

TestCase.Name: ProofKeys.CurrentInvalid.OldInvalid
TestCase.Description: Tests that hosts reject requests with invalid current and old proof keys.

TestCase.Name: ProofKeys.TimestampOlderThan20Min
TestCase.Description: Tests that hosts reject requests with an X-WOPI-Timestamp value that represents a time more than 20 minutes old.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.SingleLockInCoauthTable
TestCase.Description: Tests that a single coauth lock is requested and is reflected in the coauth table.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.SingleLockInCoauthTable.GetCoauthTableWithSameVersionAsHost
TestCase.Description: Initiates GetCoauthTable request with the same CoathTableVersion as host, host returns no response body.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockRequestOnSameCoauthLockExpirationRefresh
TestCase.Description: Tests that a coauth lock's expiration timeout is refreshed when requested with the same coauth lock id as an already existing coauth lock.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthExclusiveLockRequestOnExistingCoauthLock
TestCase.Description: Tests that a coauth exclusive lock request replaces the lock type of a coauth lock of the same id.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.UnlockCoauthLockValidation
TestCase.Description: Tests that an unlock coauth lock request unlocks the coauth lock from the coauth table.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.MultipleLocksInCoauthTable
TestCase.Description: Tests that multiple coauth locks are requested and are reflected in the coauth table.

ResponseBodyProperty.Name: CoauthTable
ResponseBodyProperty.ExpectedValue: [{CoauthLockId:'Client1', CoauthLockMetadata:'MultipleLocksInCoauthTable1', CoauthLockType:'Coauth', UserFriendlyName:'*', CoauthLockTime:'*'}, {CoauthLockId:'Client2', CoauthLockMetadata:'MultipleLocksInCoauthTable2', CoauthLockType:'Coauth', UserFriendlyName:'*', CoauthLockTime:'*'}]

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.MultipleLocksInCoauthTable.GetCoauthTableWithDifferentVersionFromHost
TestCase.Description: Tests that multiple coauth locks are requested, then GetCoauthTable with different CoauthTableVersion from host, CoauthTable will be returned.

ResponseBodyProperty.Name: CoauthTable
ResponseBodyProperty.ExpectedValue: [{CoauthLockId:'Client1', CoauthLockMetadata:'MultipleLocksInCoauthTable1', CoauthLockType:'Coauth', UserFriendlyName:'*', CoauthLockTime:'*'}, {CoauthLockId:'Client2', CoauthLockMetadata:'MultipleLocksInCoauthTable2', CoauthLockType:'Coauth', UserFriendlyName:'*', CoauthLockTime:'*'}]

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.MultipleLocksInCoauthTable.GetCoauthTableWithSameVersionAsHost
TestCase.Description: Tests that multiple coauth locks are requested, then GetCoauthTable with same CoauthTableVersion as host, no response body returned.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.UnlockCoauthLockWithMultipleLocksInCoauthTable
TestCase.Description: Tests that multiple coauth locks and coauth unlocks are requested and are reflected in the coauth table.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.MultipleTypesOfLocksInCoauthTable
TestCase.Description: Tests that multiple coauth locks of different types can exist in the coauth table.

ResponseBodyProperty.Name: CoauthTable
ResponseBodyProperty.ExpectedValue: [{CoauthLockType:'CoauthExclusive', CoauthLockId:'Client2', CoauthLockMetadata:'MultipleTypesOfLocksInCoauthTable2', UserFriendlyName:'*', CoauthLockTime:'*'}, {CoauthLockId:'Client1', CoauthLockMetadata:'MultipleTypesOfLocksInCoauthTable1', CoauthLockType:'Coauth', UserFriendlyName:'*', CoauthLockTime:'*'}]

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.MultipleTypesOfLocksInCoauthTable.GetCoauthTableWithSameVersionAsHost
TestCase.Description: Tests that multiple coauth locks of different types exist on the coauth table, then GetCoauthTable requested with same CoauthTableVersion as host, no response body returned.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.GetCoauthTableWithoutLocks
TestCase.Description: Tests that the coauth table request will return an empty array if there aren't any coauth locks.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockRequestOnExistingCoauthExclusiveLockOfSameCoauthLockId
TestCase.Description: Tests when a coauth lock is requested with the same coauth lock id as an existing coauth exclusive lock.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockRequestOnExistingCoauthExclusiveLockOfDifferentCoauthLockId
TestCase.Description: Tests when a coauth lock is requested with a different coauth lock id when a coauth exclusive lock already exists.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockMetadataValidation
TestCase.Description: Tests that the response of the coauth lock metadata is set from the passed metadata header.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.EmptyCoauthLockMetadata
TestCase.Description: Tests that the response of the coauth lock metadata is empty if the metadata header is empty.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.OmittedCoauthLockMetadata
TestCase.Description: Tests that the response of the coauth lock metadata is empty if the metadata header is omitted.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.RefreshCoauthLockWithMetadata
TestCase.Description: Tests that a refresh coauth lock request with new metadata passed changes the metadata for the coauth lock in the coauth table.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.RefreshCoauthLockWithoutMetadata
TestCase.Description: Tests that a refresh coauth lock request without metadata passed has no effect on the coauth lock metadata.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.GetCoauthLockWithoutCoauthLockType
TestCase.Description: Tests the failing of GetCoauthLock requests when missing the required parameter of CoauthLockType.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.GetCoauthLockWithoutCoauthLockId
TestCase.Description: Tests the failing of GetCoauthLock requests when missing the required parameter of CoauthLockId.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.GetCoauthLockWithoutCoauthLockExpirationTimeout
TestCase.Description: Tests the failing of GetCoauthLock requests when missing the required parameter of CoauthLockExpirationTimeout.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.UnlockCoauthLockWithoutCoauthLockId
TestCase.Description: Tests the failing of UnlockCoauth requests when missing the required parameter of CoauthLockId.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.RefreshCoauthLockWithoutCoauthLockId
TestCase.Description: Tests the failing of RefreshCoauthLock requests when missing the required parameter of CoauthLockId.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.RefreshCoauthLockWithoutCoauthLockExpirationTimeout
TestCase.Description: Tests the failing of RefreshCoauthLock requests when missing the required parameter of CoauthLockExpirationTimeout.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.InvalidCoauthLockType
TestCase.Description: Tests when the coauth lock type is set to "None" instead of "Coauth" or "CoauthExclusive."

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.EmptyCoauthLockType
TestCase.Description: Tests when the coauth lock type is empty.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockIdLengthValidationForGetCoauthLock
TestCase.Description: Tests that the CoauthLockId parameter is outside size limitations of 1024 ASCII characters for GetCoauthLock.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockIdLengthValidationForUnlockCoauthLock
TestCase.Description: Tests that the CoauthLockId parameter is outside size limitations of 1024 ASCII characters for UnlockCoauthLock.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockIdLengthValidationForRefreshCoauthLock
TestCase.Description: Tests that the CoauthLockId parameter is within size limitations of 1024 ASCII characters for RefreshCoauthLock.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.InvalidGetCoauthLockExpirationTimeout
TestCase.Description: Tests invalid timeout values for CoauthLockExpirationTimeout for GetCoauthLock.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.InvalidRefreshCoauthLockExpirationTimeout
TestCase.Description: Tests invalid timeout values for CoauthLockExpirationTimeout for RefreshCoauthLock.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthExclusiveLockRequestOnExistingCoauthExclusiveLock
TestCase.Description: Tests when a coauth exclusive lock is requested when a coauth exclusive lock already exists.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockTypeSwitchingOnExistingCoauthExclusiveLock
TestCase.Description: Tests when a coauth lock type switch from coauth to coauth exclusive lock is requested on an existing coauth exclusive lock.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.UnlockCoauthLockWithNoLocks
TestCase.Description: Tests UnlockCoauthLock conflict when requested with no existing locks.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.RefreshCoauthLockWithNoLocks
TestCase.Description: Tests RefreshCoauthLock conflict when requested with no existing locks.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockMetadataLengthValidationForGetCoauthLock
TestCase.Description: Tests that the CoauthLockMetadata parameter is within size limits of 4KB for GetCoauthLock.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockMetadataLengthValidationForRefreshCoauthLock
TestCase.Description: Tests that the CoauthLockMetadata parameter is within size limits of 4KB for RefreshCoauthLock.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockRequestOnExistingWopiLockWithLockUserVisibleTrue
TestCase.Description: Tests that ConflictingLockUsername is returned when a Coauth lock is requested after an existing Wopi lock with header LockUserVisible set true

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockMetadataSentAsBody
TestCase.Description: Tests that a coauth lock's metadata is handled properly when coauthlockmetadata is sent as part of body.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockMetadataSentAsBodyForRefreshCoauthLock
TestCase.Description: Tests that a coauth lock's metadata is handled properly when coauthlockmetadata is sent as part of body.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockMetadataSentAsBodyAndHeader
TestCase.Description: Tests that a coauth lock's metadata is handled properly when coauthlockmetadata is sent as part of body and header. Body value is given preference over header

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockMetadataSentAsBodyAndHeaderForRefreshCoauthLock
TestCase.Description: Tests that a coauth lock's metadata is handled properly when coauthlockmetadata is sent as part of body and header. Body value is given preference over header.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockMetadataSentAsBodyAndHeaderForMultipleLocks
TestCase.Description: Tests that a coauth lock's metadata is handled properly when coauthlockmetadata is sent as part of body and header. Body value is given preference over header.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockMetadataSentAsBodyAndHeaderSetToEmpty
TestCase.Description: Tests that a coauth lock's metadata is handled properly when coauthlockmetadata is sent as part of body and header. Body value is given preference over header and set to empty.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockMetadataSentAsBodySetToEmpty
TestCase.Description: Tests that a coauth lock's metadata is handled properly when coauthlockmetadata is sent as part of body. Body value is set to empty.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockMetadataSentAsBodySetToEmptyRefreshCoauthLock
TestCase.Description: Tests that a coauth lock's metadata is handled properly when coauthlockmetadata is sent as part of body. Body value is set to empty. If present and empty or null, the CoauthLockMetadata value remains unchanged. If present and is set to a non-empty string, CoauthLockMetadata is overwritten with that value.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.FileNotLockedAndFileSizeNotZero.FailWithConflict409
TestCase.Description: Host file is not locked and size is larger than 0.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.ClientCoauthLockMismatchWithHostCoauthLock.FailWithConflict409
TestCase.Description: PutChunkedFile using a mismatched coauth lock.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.ClientCoauthLockAndWopiLockSetTogether.FailWithBadRequest400
TestCase.Description: PutChunkedFile with WOPI Lock and Coauth Lock set at the same time.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.ClientWopiLockMismatchWithHostWopiLock.FailWithConflict409
TestCase.Description: Host file is locked by WOPI Lock but client "X-WOPI-Lock" value does not match the lock currently on the file.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.ClientCoauthLockMismatchWithHostWopiLock.FailWithConflict409
TestCase.Description: File on host is locked by a WOPI Lock and the client provides a Coauth Lock.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.ClientCoauthLockMismatchWithHostCoauthExclusiveLock.FailWithConflict409
TestCase.Description: File on host is locked by CoauthExclusive lock and client present a CoauthLock.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.ClientWopiLockMismatchWithHostCoauthExclusiveLock.FailWithConflict409
TestCase.Description: File on host is locked by CoauthExclusiveLock and client presents a Wopi lock.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.ClientWopiLockMismatchWithHostCoauthLock.FailWithConflict409
TestCase.Description: File on host is locked by CoauthLock, and client presents Wopi Lock.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.ClientSequenceNumberMismatchWithHost.PreconditionFail412
TestCase.Description: Sequence number provided by the WOPI client does not match the latest value on the host.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.FullFile.UploadWithCoauthLock.Success
TestCase.Description: Initiate a single put chunked file request with Coauth lock.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.FullFile.UploadWithCoauthExclusiveLock.Success
TestCase.Description: Initiate a single put chunked file request with Coauth Exclusive lock.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.FullFile.UploadWithWopiLock.Success
TestCase.Description: Initiate a single put chunked file request with WOPI lock.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.FullFile.DeltaUploadsAndFullDownload.Success
TestCase.Description: Multiple put chunked file requests.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.FullFile.FileNotLockedAndFileSizeZero.Success
TestCase.Description: Host file is not locked and size is zero.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.FullFile.DownloadUnexistedStreamShouldReturnEmptyStream.Success
TestCase.Description: Client download streams that are not existed on host should return empty stream.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.FullFile.UploadSubsetOfFileStreams.Success
TestCase.Description: Client upload subset of streams of a document, unmentioned streams should remain as they are.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.FullFile.PutChunkedFileWithContentPropertiesAndPutFile.SuccessWithContentPropertyCleanedUp
TestCase.Description: PutChunkedFile request first followed with PutFile request. ContentProperties with Retention = DeleteOnContentChange should be cleaned up.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.FullFile.DownloadWithLastZipChunk.Success
TestCase.Description: Client sends GetChunkedFile request with ChunksToReturn set to LastZipChunk. If the file is not a zip archive, this would behave the same as None.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.UploadWithCoauthLock.Success
TestCase.Description: Initiate a single Zip format upload request with Coauth lock, followed by Zip format download request.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.DownloadWithNoneChunksToReturn.Success
TestCase.Description: Initiate a single Zip format upload request with Coauth lock, followed by ChunksToReturn.None Zip format download request.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.DownloadWithLastZipChunk.Success
TestCase.Description: Initiate a single Zip format upload request with Coauth lock, followed by ChunksToReturn.LastZipChunk Zip format download request.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.DownloadWithZipAndHostReturnsFullFileDueToNonZipArchive.Success
TestCase.Description: Initiate a single FullFile format upload request with Coauth lock, followed by Zip format download, but host returns FullFile format because host content not eligible for Zip.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.DownloadFullFileAndHostReturnsZipDueToContentEligibleForZip.Success
TestCase.Description: Initiate a single Zip format upload request with Coauth lock, followed by FullFile download request but host returns Zip Chunking format because host content eligible for Zip.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.UploadWithCoauthExclusiveLock.Success
TestCase.Description: Initiate a single Zip format upload request with Coauth Exclusive lock, followed by Zip format download.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.UploadWithWopiLock.Success
TestCase.Description: Initiate a single Zip format upload request with WOPI lock, followed by Zip format download.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.DeltaUploadsAndFullDownload.Success
TestCase.Description: Multiple Zip format upload requests, followed by Zip format full download.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.DeltaUploadsAndDeltaDownloadZeroBlobs.Success
TestCase.Description: Multiple Zip format upload requests, followed by Zip format delta download.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.DeltaUploadsAndDeltaDownloadNonZeroBlobs.Success
TestCase.Description: Multiple Zip format upload requests, followed by Zip format delta download.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.FileNotLockedAndFileSizeZero.Success
TestCase.Description: Host file is not locked and size is zero.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.DownloadUnexistedStreamShouldReturnEmptyStream.Success
TestCase.Description: Client download streams that are not existed on host should return empty stream.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.UploadSubsetOfFileStreams.Success
TestCase.Description: Client upload subset of streams of a document, unmentioned streams should remain as they are.

TestCase.Name: IncrementalFileTransfer.Zip.PutChunkedFileWithContentPropertiesAndPutFile.SuccessWithContentPropertyCleanedUp
TestCase.Description: PutChunkedFile request first followed with PutFile request. ContentProperties with Retention = DeleteOnContentChange should be cleaned up.

TestCase.Name: RenameFile.ClientPresentsCoauthLockWithHostCoauthLock.Success
TestCase.Description: Client sends RenameFile request with same CoauthLock on host. Request should succeed with file content unchanged.

TestCase.Name: RenameFile.ClientPresentsCoauthLockWithHostNoLock.Success
TestCase.Description: Client sends RenameFile request with CoauthLock and host file is unlocked. Request should succeed.

TestCase.Name: RenameFile.ClientPresentsNoLockWithHostNoLock.Success
TestCase.Description: Client sends RenameFile request with neither Wopi nor CoauthLock being set and host file is unlocked. Request should succeed.

TestCase.Name: RenameFile.ClientPresentsNoLockWithHostCoauthLock.FailWithConflict409
TestCase.Description: Client sends RenameFile request with neither Wopi nor CoauthLock being set. Host file is locked by CoauthLock. Request should fail with 409 Conflict.

TestCase.Name: RenameFile.ClientPresentsWopiLockWithHostCoauthLock.FailWithConflict409
TestCase.Description: Client sends RenameFile request with Wopi lock. Host file is locked by CoauthLock. Request should fail with 409 Conflict.

TestCase.Name: RenameFile.ClientPresentsWrongCoauthLockWithHostCoauthLock.FailWithConflict409
TestCase.Description: Client sends RenameFile request with CoauthLock. Host file is locked by CoauthLock but presented lock id does not exist in coauth table. Request should fail with 409 Conflict.

TestCase.Name: RenameFile.ClientPresentsCoauthLockWithHostWopiLock.FailWithConflict409
TestCase.Description: Client sends RenameFile request with CoauthLock. Host file is locked by WopiLock. Request should fail with 409 Conflict.

TestCase.Name: RenameFile.ClientCoauthLockAndWopiLockSetTogether.FailWithBadRequest400
TestCase.Description: Client sends RenameFile request with WopiLock and CoauthLock being set together. Request should fail with 400 BadRequest.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.GetCoauthTableAfterLockExpiration
TestCase.Description: Tests that the coauth table request will return only coauth locks that have not expired.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.RefreshCoauthLockValidation
TestCase.Description: Tests that a refresh coauth lock request refreshes the coauth lock expiration timeout.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.CoauthLockExpirationTimeoutValidation
TestCase.Description: Tests that a coauth lock timeout expiration is reflected in the coauth table.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.UnlockCoauthLockOnExpiredCoauthLock
TestCase.Description: Tests UnlockCoauthLock on an expired coauth lock.

TestCase.Name: CoauthLock.RefreshCoauthLockOnExpiredCoauthLock
TestCase.Description: Tests RefreshCoauthLock on an expired lock.
